com.example.foodtracker3

Class HomeFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
      • com.example.foodtracker3.HomeFragment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, android.widget.AdapterView.OnItemSelectedListener, androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner, androidx.savedstate.SavedStateRegistryOwner

    public class HomeFragment
extends androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
implements android.widget.AdapterView.OnItemSelectedListener
    The Home Fragment is rendered in the Main Activity on click of the Home navigation item, and when the app starts initially.
    Version:
    1.0.0 Jun 7, 2020
    Author:
    Andrew Dineen, Aidan Fallstorm, Rick Patneaude, Eli Storlie, Marco Villafana

      • removeItem

        public void removeItem(int position,
                       java.util.ArrayList<Product> list,
                       androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter adapter,
                       DatabaseHelper dbh)
        Contains the logic for removing an item from the list and the database. This method is called when the user clicks "Yes" on the delete confirmation.
        Parameters:
        position - The position in the ArrayList of the item to be deleted.
        list - The list of products to delete from.
        adapter - The adapter to notify of content change.
        dbh - Thr database helper object used to delete the item from the database.
